snippet.title: Team calls in back-up for state's top bowler
snippet.content: LAWN BOWLS: Darren Muir is eager to have a tilt at the club champion of champions pairs state title but will have to get through the next round without his playing partner, Queensland's top-ranked bowler Kurt Brown. The duo squeezed through the final at Kawana to be crowned top team there before winning the Sunshine Coast district crown. Next is a clash against the best team from the Fraser Coast, at Coolum Beach, on August 14. But Brown will be overseas so he is set to be replaced by Lewis Stumbris. "I'll have to skip this next game and Lewis will lead for me but he's been playing well for the club so hopefully we can get though that game," Muir said. A victory there would propel the team into the state final, which Brown would be able to contest. "He's number one in Queensland at the moment so he's a big asset to the side obviously," Muir said. Brown's influence has proved telling in the competition so far. His shot on the third extra end of the Kawana club final was decisive. Muir said the pair trailed 22-10 after 14 of 21 ends but battled back into contention against Mike Stevenson and Tony Bush. Then when the game was on the line, the skip turned what looked like a two-shot deficit into a one-shot gain with a neat draw which sealed victory. "It was a massive bowl in the context of us getting through," Muir said. Muir and Brown then progressed through the district section, beating Australian Open round of 16 pair, Caloundra's Wade Mutzelburg and Joel Anderson in the semi-finals, before toppling Nambour Heights 37-4 in the decider last week.
